For The Orwells, Remember When will be an introduction of sortsÃ¢â‚¬â€the 12-track rat-race shows the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s repertoire of pranging riffs and sneering, snot-nosed vocals. The tracks are a walloping war-cry from a generation that up until this point has only offered bubblegum popÃ¢â‚¬â€the animus of The Orwells. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s quite clear early on the in listening to the LP that the band is well aware of the past, the homage rings through the record, using the ghost of punkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s past as their musical sprit guide. However, the band straddles the thing line between their influences and their originality, ripping riffs and smashing drums in a fashion that their age into being just another fact mentioned in their bio.

The Orwells are made up of five dudes from Chicago, Illinois. They play rock n roll music. Their names are Mario, Grant, Henry, Dominick and Matt. They write songs Ã¢â‚¬â€ scratch that, primitive teenage battle cries Ã¢â‚¬â€ about girls and America and being suspended from high school. Although one might categorize The OrwellsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ distinct brand of the blues as garage or punk, they would be wrong. The Orwells sound comes from a deeper, different placeÃ¢â‚¬â€œa place both long forgotten and also timeless.
